ygData.subject: Re: Twinking
ygData.msgSnippet: Yow, I hope you mean in EQ . . . but I suspect not. Since I seem to be unable to stay away from this issue, just wanted to point out that I agree, it s
ygData.messageBody:
Yow, I hope you mean in EQ . . . but I suspect
not.<br><br>Since I seem to be unable to stay away from this issue,
just wanted to point out that I agree, it's the 50th
level character twinking his 1st or 2nd level character
that's annoying. That's what started me on this whole
thing over on the Everlore Rogue board. It was just the
attitude of the guy that got under my skin -- "How should
I twink my little rogey?"<br><br>Oh, now I know why
I can't stay away from this discussion -- I'm away
from home this week and haven't played in FOUR DAYS.
I'm jonesin' something severe . . . <br><br>Oh, but
one more thing, this on alts and mains. I have a
couple of alts, just a coupe of 2nd levels. But I'm
actually thinking of giving up on them -- it seems it
would be more fun to experience everything Norrath has
to offer through the eyes of my main character. I
started a Dwarf Paladin, and it wasn't as fun to
"discover" Kaladim as it had been with my main character,
because I knew the place already. <br><br>This might just
be a matter of how deeply I identify with Dwarf
Rogues/Thieves (the class I always played in D&D). But no,
that's not odd or anything . . .<br><br>Kharlisht of
Kaladim<br>11th season Rogue<br>Drinal
